text: Andrew Lesnie (1 January 1956 - 27 April 2015) was an Australian movie cinematographer. He was best known as the cinematographer for The Lord of the Rings trilogy (2001-2003) and its prequel The Hobbit trilogy (2012-2014), both directed by New Zealand director Peter Jackson. He received the Academy Award for Best Cinematography for his work on The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring in 2002. He also worked on I Am Legend (2007) and The Water Diviner (2014). Lesnie was born in Sydney, New South Wales.
